Seasonal Kendall Trend Test

kendell_test_5_20_years.Rd

Test for five and twenty year trends in groundwater level using the Seasonal Kendall Trend Test.

kendell_test_5_20_years(
  gwl,
  date_col = "lev_dt",
  value_col = "sl_lev_va",
  alpha = 0.95,
  seasonal = TRUE,
  enough_5 = 10,
  enough_20 = 6,
  include_current_year = FALSE
)

Arguments

gwl

data frame that must include a numeric column defined by "value_col", and a Date or POSIXct column defined by "date_col"
date_col

name of date column.
value_col

name of value column.
alpha

the confidence level to use for statistical significance
seasonal

logical. Use a seasonal kendall test or not seasonal. Default is TRUE.
enough_5

number per year. Default is 10.
enough_20

numbr per year. Default is 6.
include_current_year

a logical indicating whether to include data from the current calendar year in the test.

Value

a data frame of test results from 5 and 20 year Kendall Seasonal Trend test

Details

At least 10 readings per year for the last 5 years are required for the 5-year test, and at least 6 readings for the last 20 years are required for the 20-year test. The current calendar year is excluded by default.

Examples


# site <- "260041080093102"
# gw_level_data <- dataRetrieval::readNWISgwl(site)

# Using package example data:
gwl_data <- L2701_example_data$Discrete
kendell_test_5_20_years(gwl_data)
#> Not enough measurements in each of the the last 5 years to proceed
#>            test         tau    pValue       slope intercept           trend
#> 1  5-year trend          NA        NA          NA        NA            <NA>
#> 2 20-year trend -0.04106885 0.4894787 -0.05597039  102.0067 Not significant
